intro: Thlaspi arvernense, commonly known as the French Shepherd's Purse, is a flowering plant native to Central and Southern Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has distinctive heart-shaped seed pods that split open when mature. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Thlaspi arvernense is also known for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats.
